abstract.text: The formatting properties for a PIN, such as character encoding and length constraints.

abstract.text: Access security tokens and the cryptographic assets they store.
A representation of a smart card.
Creates a new user interaction object for secure PIN change using the smart card reader facilities (typically a HW keypad).
Creates and returns a new user interaction object for secure PIN verification using the Smart Card reader facilities.
The formatting properties for a PIN, such as character encoding and length constraints.
Possible PIN character sets.
Possible PIN encoding types.
Possible PIN justification types
The format of PIN characters.
by default.
The encoding of PIN characters.
by default.
The maximum number of characters to form a valid PIN.
by default.
The minimum number of characters to form a valid PIN.
by default.
The offset, in bits, within the PIN block to mark a location for filling in the formatted PIN, which is justified with respect to the
property value.
by default.
The total length of the PIN block in bytes.
by default.
The justification within the PIN block.
by default.
The offset, in bits, within the PIN block to mark a location for filling in the PIN length, which is always left justified.
by default.
The size, in bits, of the PIN length field. If set to
, PIN length is not written.
by default.
The base class for encapsulating user interaction with a Smart Card reader.
A representation of user interaction for secure PIN operations on a Smart Card reader.
A representation of the user interaction for secure PIN change operations on a Smart Card reader.
A representation of the user interaction for secure PIN change verification on a Smart Card reader.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
